question.questionA: Plants without milky latex; male  and female flowers in separate clusters.
question.questionB: Plants with milky latex; several male flowers and one female flower encircled by an involucre and forming a compound cluster.

question.questionA: Leaves palmately lobed.
question.questionB: Leaves not palmately lobed.

question.questionA: Plants dioecious; leaves opposite.
question.questionB: Plants monoecious; leaves alternate.

question.questionA: Robust shrub with red stems,  forming rounded bushes up to 2m across.
question.questionB: Herbaceous plants, considerably less than 2m across.

question.questionA: Glabrous annuals or perennials; leaves caducous; glands with two or four horns or hornless; primary umbel  usually absent, axillary umbels numerous, compound.
question.questionB: Annuals  or  perennials;  primary  umbels  usual ly present, secondary umbels few or absent.

question.questionA: Annuals or biennials, usually with one basal stem.
question.questionB: Perennials, usually with several stems arising from the base.

question.questionA: Plants  yellow-green; capsules pale grey or brown, transversely grooved.
question.questionB: Capsules not transversely grooved.

question.questionA: Leaves fleshy, markedly asymmetrical at the base; capsule c. 3mm, smooth, ovoid.
question.questionB: Leaves not markedly asymmetrical at the base.

question.questionA: Leaves slightly asymmetrical, often emarginate and serrulate; glands with rounded white appendages; seed 2 mm, elongated, quadrangular, with faint transverse ridges.
question.questionB: Leaves symmetrical, not emarginate.

question.questionA: Leaves linear; capsule up to 2mm, smooth or slightly tuberculate on the keels.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate or oblong.

question.questionA: Leaves obovate, sessile.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate, petiolate.

question.questionA: Capsule winged.
question.questionB: Capsule wingless.

question.questionA: Leaves  glaucous,  serrulate  towards the tip; seeds 1 mm, black, rugulose.
question.questionB: Leaves yellow-green, entire; seeds grey, longitudinally grooved on the front, pitted dorsally.

question.questionA: Plants hairy.
question.questionB: Plants glabrous.

question.questionA: Plants hirsute; leaves pale green; axillary rays common; capsule tuberculate; seeds with dark tubercles and prominent, comma-shaped, white caruncle.
question.questionB: Plants  tomentose or minutely papillose  (use  lens);  leaves glaucous; axillary rays absent.

question.questionA: Plants minutely papillose; leaves and bracts serrulate; seeds white or dark grey, sometimes ridged or tuberculate.
question.questionB: Plants tomentose; leaves and bracts entire; seeds silver-grey, smooth.

question.questionA: Leaves and bracts serrate; leaves glaucous; bracts yellow.
question.questionB: Neither leaves nor bracts serrate.

question.questionA: Rays short-stalked, terminal, buried in the axils of the leaves; capsule 5 mm, smooth.
question.questionB: Rays on prominent stalks.

question.questionA: Plants  decumbent;  leaves  petiolate, leaf-tips acute, rounded, or emarginate; axillary rays absent.
question.questionB: Plants erect; leaves sessile, leaf-tips not variable in shape; axillary rays present.

question.questionA: Leaves light green; some axillary rays whorled below terminal  umbel; glands with club-shaped horns; seeds grey, shallowly ridged.
question.questionB: Leaves glaucous; axillary rays not whorled.

question.questionA: Plants with few branches emerging from the base; leaves numerous, closely overlapping; capsule glabrous, granular.
question.questionB: Plants with many branches emerging from the base; leaves, distant, not overlapping; capsule glabrous, smooth.
